intro: Lachenalia marginata subsp. marginata, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and succulent, helping it store water during dry periods. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
